Advanced.Enable duplicate page submissions: Yes - Enable page to be re-posted

Help.Help Text: This wizard allows the uploading of customer data into this application. Two options are provided to upload data, by uploading a comma separated file (.CSV), or to copy and paste data directly into the page. The second step maps database column names with the uploaded data. The third step, shows the data after lookups keys have been detected and validated. Customer names that match are updated, new customers are added. Statuses, types, and/or categories that do not match are not inserted or updated. They are ignored.

Source.HTML Code:
To load or update customer data from a spreadsheet follow the following instructions.

  1. Organize data in a spreadsheet with column headings of "Customer Name", "Summary", "Category", "Status", "Type", and so forth.
  2. If you have additional attributes you want to load you can load these into custom attributes. Simply add these columns as well and you can map them to custom attributes in the next step of the data loading wizard.
  3. Ensure the Categories and Status values match the categories defined in this application. Administrators of this application can define categories and status values. The current values are displayed on this page for reference.
  4. Once you have your data organized in your spreadsheet you can export the data to CSV format (recommended for larger data sets), or simply cut and paste the data (including column headings) into the text field on this page.
  5. Follow the wizard and load your data.

Custom attribute data, data that this application does not natively track, can be loaded into custom attribute fields with character, number and date data types. To have this data show about customers, Application administrators can define these custom attributes from the administration page.

Source.SQL Query:
select category,
    description,
    decode(is_active,'Y',:ACTIVE_MSG,:INACTIVE_MSG) Status
from eba_cust_categories
order by upper(category)

Header and Footer.Header Text: Customer categories must be one of the valid values from the list below. Application administrators can extend this list of values from the administrative console.

Source.HTML Code:
Click the Try Sample Data button to test data loading functionality. The sample data has 5 columns, 4 of which match the customer data structures. The location can be used to demonstrate extensibility via flexible attributes.

Customer Name Summary Category Location Status
Altiris Software Corporate New York NY Partner
Cephalon biotechnology Corporate San Francisco Unknown
Euronet Worldwide banking software Corporate - Unknown
Illumina biotechnology equipment Corporate - Customer

Source.SQL Query:
select type,
    description,
    decode(is_active,'Y',:ACTIVE_MSG,:INACTIVE_MSG) status
from eba_cust_type
order by upper(type)

Header and Footer.Header Text: Customer status values must be one of the valid status values listed below. Administrators of this application can extend and modify customer status values from application administration.

Source.SQL Query:
select status customer_status,
    description,
    decode(is_active,'Y',:ACTIVE_MSG,:INACTIVE_MSG) status
from eba_cust_status
order by upper(status)

Header and Footer.Header Text: Customer status values must be one of the valid status values listed below. Administrators of this application can extend and modify customer status values from application administration.

Help.Help Text: Enter a delimiter character. You can use this character to delineate the starting and ending boundary of a data value. If you specify a delimiter character, Data Workshop ignores whitespace occurring before the starting and ending boundary of a data value. You can also use this option to enclose a data value with the specified delimiter character.

Source.SQL Query:
select value
  from nls_session_parameters
 where parameter = 'NLS_CURRENCY'
Source.Used: Only when current value in session state is null

Help.Help Text: If your data contains international currency symbol, enter it here. For example, if your data has "€1,234.56" or "¥1,234.56", enter "€" or "¥".  Otherwise the data will not load correctly.

Source.Used: Only when current value in session state is null

Help.Help Text:
A group separator is a character that separates integer groups, for example to show thousands and millions.

Any character can be the group separator. The character specified must be single-byte, and the group separator must be different from any other decimal character. The character can be a space, but cannot be a numeric character or any of the following:

  • plus (+)
  • hyphen (-)
  • less than sign (<)
  • greater than sign (>)

Source.Used: Only when current value in session state is null

Help.Help Text:
The decimal character separates the integer and decimal parts of a number.

Any character can be the decimal character. The character specified must be single-byte, and the decimal character must be different from group separator. The character can be a space, but cannot be any numeric character or any of the following characters:

  • plus (+)
  • hyphen (-)
  • less than sign (<)
  • greater than sign (>)
